Resample a Learner on a Task

Source: R/resample.R
resample.Rd

Runs a resampling (possibly in parallel).

resample(task, learner, resampling, measures = NULL,
  ctrl = exec_control())

Arguments

task

(Task)
Object of type Task.
learner

(Learner)
Object of type Learner.
resampling

(Resampling)
Object of type Resampling.
measures

(list of Measure)
List of performance measures used to assess the predictive performance. Defaults to the measures stored in task.
ctrl

(list returned by exec_control())
Object to control various parts of the execution. See exec_control().

Value

ResampleResult.

Examples

task = mlr_tasks$get("iris")
learner = mlr_learners$get("classif.rpart")
resampling = mlr_resamplings$get("cv")
rr = resample(task, learner, resampling)
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 1/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 2/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 3/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 4/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 5/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 6/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 7/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 8/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 9/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.rpart' on task 'iris (iteration 10/10)' ...
print(rr)
#> ResampleResult of learner 'iris' on task 'classif.rpart' with 10 iterations
#>  Measure Min.    1st Qu.     Median Mean    3rd Qu. Max.       Sd
#>     mmce    0 0.01666667 0.06666667 0.06 0.06666667  0.2 0.058373
rr$aggregated
#> mmce 
#> 0.06 
rr$performance
#>     iteration       mmce
#>  1:         1 0.06666667
#>  2:         2 0.06666667
#>  3:         3 0.20000000
#>  4:         4 0.06666667
#>  5:         5 0.06666667
#>  6:         6 0.00000000
#>  7:         7 0.06666667
#>  8:         8 0.00000000
#>  9:         9 0.00000000
#> 10:        10 0.06666667

# Repeat resampling with dummy learner and combine
# the ResampleResults into a BenchmarkResult
learner = mlr_learners$get("classif.dummy")
rr.dummy = resample(task, learner, resampling)
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 1/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 2/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 3/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 4/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 5/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 6/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 7/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 8/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 9/10)' ...
#> Running learner 'classif.dummy' on task 'iris (iteration 10/10)' ...

bmr = rr$combine(rr.dummy)
bmr$performance[, list(mean.mmce = mean(mmce)), by = "learner"]
#>          learner mean.mmce
#> 1: classif.dummy 0.7866667
#> 2: classif.rpart 0.0600000
